intro: Psychotria cephaloides, commonly known as the "Cephaloides Psychotria," is a species of flowering plant in the Rubiaceae family. It is native to the tropical regions of Central and South America, particularly in the Amazon rainforest. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves and clusters of small, white to pale yellow flowers. It produces small, dark blue to black berries that are often consumed by birds and other animals. Psychotria cephaloides is also known for its psychoactive properties due to the presence of alkaloids such as psychotamine.
